revisionDesc.change: Automated transfer of accents across reg-orig pairs
Vote - Accept-Straight-to-FInalization - Accept. A good correction. Lin3 corr-->reg

I corrected á¼Î³Î³ÏÎ±Ï†á½´ in á¼Î³{Î³}ÏÎ¬Ï†Î·. The edition has ÎµÎ³Î³ÏÎ±Ï†Î·, without accent or note. In the index (p. 849) ÎµÎ³Î³ÏÎ±Ï†Î· is under Î³ÏÎ¬Ï†Ï‰ (and not á¼Î³Î³ÏÎ±Ï†Î®), making clear that the editor recognized the aor. pass. of Î³ÏÎ¬Ï†Ï‰.

Vote - AcceptText - Accept. See Delattre and Hickey, to which add: lin1--> (Î´Î­Î´Ï‰(ÎºÎµÎ½)) (have checked BL and Tyche 14 (1999) 331); lin5,6 put entire word on both sides of corr-->reg tags. I think Delattre is right about á¼Î³ÏÎ¬Ï†Î·, but better not to muddy the editorial stream; will email to suggest he submit separate argument for emendation. Lin8--> <:(ÏƒÏ„Î¿Î¹Ï‡(Îµá¿–))(?)|reg|(ÏƒÏ„Î·Ï‡(Îµá¿–)):>

Vote - ReturnToSender - Accept (voting return to get a third opinion on Lin8) as Delattre AND Lin1 <:á¼”Ì£Ï‡Ì£Ï‰ á¼Ì£Î³á½¼|BL:12.8|(Î´Î­(Î´Ï‰ÎºÎµÎ½)):> Lin 2: add <#=9#> after ordinal. Lin5: add <#=14#> after ÏƒÎµÏÎ±, <#=1/2#> after fraction Lin5,6 coding of last word of line is nonstandard and should be fixed. Lin6 (Î³Î¯(Î½Î¿Î½Ï„Î±Î¹)), so edition Lin7: use first of Delattre's suggestions Lin8 (Î¼(ÎµÏ„?)á½°Ì£) (ÎºÏ…(ÏÎ¯Î¿Ï…?)) Lin8 <:(ÏƒÏ„Î¿Î¹Ï‡(Îµá¿–))(?)|reg|(|ÏƒÏ„Î·Ï‡|):> Throughout: change corr tags to reg and articulate right sides.

Vote - AcceptText - Accept. Line 1: add the language and a dot below the second Ï©: ~|â²¡â²“Ï©â²—â²Ï©Ì£|~cop. Line 2: the toponym is Coptic: ~|Ï©â²Ÿâ²£â²Ÿâ²©â²­|~cop. Line 3: (á¼°Î½Î´ÎµÌ£(Î¹ÎºÏ„Î¯Ï‰Î½Î¿Ï‚)) should be corrected: <:(á¼°Î½Î´(Î¹ÎºÏ„Î¯Ï‰Î½Î¿Ï‚))|reg|(á¼°Î½Î´ÎµÌ£(Î¹ÎºÏ„Î¯Ï‰Î½Î¿Ï‚)):>. Line 7: I have great doubt about á¼Î³Î³ÏÎ±Ï†Î®. In the edition, there is no accent and no interpretation of the sequence. It is more probably to be read á¼Î³{Î³}ÏÎ¬Ï†Î· (or <:á¼Î³ÏÎ¬Ï†Î·|reg|á¼Î³Î³ÏÎ¬Ï†Î·:>. Line 8: add a ? in ÎºÏ…(ÏÎ¯Î¿Ï…): (ÎºÏ…(ÏÎ¯Î¿Ï…)?).
